TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConnectorAccessibleObject extends System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides information on connectors between activity designers that accessibility applications use to adjust an application's UI for users with impairments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
When using a freeform layout, activity designers are connected to each other using the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.Connector> class. The ConnectorAccessibleObject class is used to provide information on these connectors between activity designers that accessibility applications use to adjust an application's UI.
Also, you can use this class to customize the drawing when you derive a class from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.Connector>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.Connector connector) cil managed

Docs.param: An instance of which represents a connector between two activity designers on a workflow design surface.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class using an instance of .
Gets the location and size of the accessible object.
Docs.value: Rectangle containing location and size information for the accessible object

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject HitTest (int x, int y);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject HitTest(int32 x, int32 y) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the child object at the specified screen coordinates.
Docs.returns: An the child object at the given screen coordinates. This method returns the calling object if the object itself is at the location specified. Returns a null reference (in Visual Basic) if no object is at the tested location.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object name.
Docs.value: String value representing the name of the accessible object

Docs.summary: Gets the parent of an accessible object.
Docs.value: Parent object for the accessible object

Docs.summary: Gets the role of this accessible object.
Docs.value: One of the values of AccessibleRole.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `AccessibleRole` property describes what kind of user interface element an object is. If the control's role cannot be determined, the `AccessibleRole` property is set to `Default`.
